Key Notes: Safest overall; broad, gradual NW route; first ascent 1954 (Austrian); budget-friendly with low technical demands.
Shares Everest base camp; steep, icy with rockfall; first ascent 1956 (Swiss); harder than Everest per some climbers.
Highest & most expensive (Nepal permit $15k); crowds but unforgiving death zone; first ascent 1953 (Hillary/Norgay).
Cheapest overall; steady snow slopes in Karakoram; first ascent 1956 (Austrian); ideal first 8000er.
Exhausting ridge at altitude; non-technical but windy; first ascent 1957 (Austrian).
Avalanche-prone "easy" peak; popular Everest training; first ascent 1956 (Japanese).
Technically difficult with sharp ridges; few attempts; first ascent 1955 (French).
Lowest 8000er; historically restricted; unpredictable winds; first ascent 1964 (Chinese).
Steep ice walls vs. GII; "Hidden Peak"; first ascent 1958 (American).
Steep, avalanche-heavy; remote approach; first ascent 1960 (Swiss-Austro-Nepalese).
Sacred & remote; unstable weather; many stop short of summit; first ascent 1955 (British).
"Killer Mountain"; massive Rupal Face; first ascent 1953 (Austrian solo).
Second-highest & most technical; infamous Bottleneck; first ascent 1954 (Italian).
Highest fatality; extreme avalanches; first 8000er summited (1950, French).
